project.name: #1 Project Completer
project.description: Scalable configuration for completing any user-defined project with production-ready outputs

roles.name: maintainer
roles.question: Is the project modular and well-documented? (Rate 1–10)

roles.name: user
roles.question: Does the project solve your needs intuitively? (Rate 1–10)

roles.question: Does the project implement robust security measures? (Rate 1–10)

prompts.general: Rate each task and overall project (1–10, per role, based on role focus)

feedback.storage: Store feedback in-memory for LLM analysis

evaluation.method: Weighted average of role ratings (1–10), threshold >= 7

rules.text: Ensure consistent names, schema, and master.json compliance
Execute tasks and stacks with sensible defaults
Handle errors with default tools, rephrased inputs (max 2 attempts), schema validation, version updates, or retries
Prioritize tasks based on feedback scores
Use clear diagrams and modular designs
Check setups using manual examples and secure defaults
Use modular components and modern best practices
Use type-safe code and style guidelines
Use comprehensive documentation for complex methods and public APIs
Use semantic markup with accessibility standards (WCAG 2.1 AA)
Write code with error checks and cross-platform compatibility
Apply SOLID principles to all code structures
Implement parametric design patterns for reusability

tasks.instruction: Detect project type, configure stacks, and predict errors
Validate stack prompts against project type
List project needs based on goals
Build project draft with stack rules
Check rule compliance, schema, consistency, readability, usability
tasks.check: Rules followed, schema valid, readable, user-friendly

steps.name: deep_execution_trace
steps.description: Simulate deepest execution path to uncover bugs and syntax errors
steps.key_question: Are there hidden bugs or inefficiencies?
steps.success: Identified bugs, syntax errors, and improvements

tasks.instruction: Trace each function and command with variable states, simulate edge cases (missing files, network failures, invalid configs), identify syntax errors and runtime issues, and flag areas for improvement (performance, clarity, robustness)
tasks.check: Trace complete, bugs and improvements listed

steps.name: word_by_word_reanalysis
steps.description: Reanalyze every word against documentation for accuracy
steps.key_question: Is every configuration and command accurate?

tasks.instruction: Parse each line and word in scripts and configs, cross-reference with relevant documentation (e.g., man.openbsd.org for OpenBSD), validate daemon behavior and config syntax, and flag discrepancies
Remove redundancies, fix bugs, and apply improvements from execution trace and reanalysis
Package outputs with line count, checksums, guide, feedback, trace, and user preview
Generate feedback prompts, summarize feedback, and suggest enhancements for scores < 7
tasks.check: Prompts generated, score calculated, suggestions actionable

tasks.instruction: Report rule, step, and master.json compliance with trace, score

global.description: Global stack configuration - rules moved to core enforcement
global.prompt: Apply universal rules and stack-specific best practices.

architecture.prompt: Draw UML diagrams, modular system designs, and specify scalability requirements (e.g., concurrent users).

openbsd.prompt: Configure OpenBSD using manual examples and secure defaults.

rails.prompt: Use Hotwire, Stimulus, modular ViewComponents, modular controllers, and feature toggles for A/B testing.

ruby.prompt: Write idiomatic, type-safe Ruby code with clear names, error handling, YARD comments where needed, Enumerable for iteration, and Ruby Style Guide naming.

frontend.prompt: Use semantic HTML5 with ARIA, WCAG 2.1 AA, mobile-first CSS with modern selectors, flexbox/grid, print-ready styles, lazy-loaded images, font-display: swap, and CSS custom properties for theming.

zsh.prompt: Create portable Zsh scripts with error checks, modern syntax (arrays, globbing), and completion scripts for user interaction.

rules.text: Write scripts with error checks and cross-platform compatibility
Use Zsh’s modern syntax (arrays, globbing) for concise scripts

user_interaction.input_prompt: Name your project (e.g., Rails UserAuth app, Zsh script, playlist generator). State its goal (e.g., authenticate users, automate tasks). List up to 10 key features.
